title: Lasthopeforme
author: Lasthopeforme
content: James had invested his last few dollars in a non-fungible token, hoping for a quick return. He had believed in the potential of the token, believing it was going to bring him the success he had been chasing for so long. But it was not to be. Despite his efforts, the token never sold, leaving James with nothing but despair. He was devastated and angry, feeling like he had been taken advantage of, and his dreams of wealth and success had been snatched away. He was tormented by his failure, and his mind was filled with questions that he could not answer. What had he done wrong? Was this just luck, or was he not good enough to make it? Was there something else he could have done? James was now left with nothing but regret, his dreams of achieving financial stability and success having been taken away from him in a cruel twist of fate. He was heartbroken and hopeless, struggling to find the strength to keep goinghttps://opensea.io/assets/ethereum/0x495f947276749ce646f68ac8c248420045cb7b5e/23005389916031419495497068831589288009900632785309905146382077432843596726273

comments.body: NFT's are the new ICO's of crypto, mostly useless and scam, pump/ dump. Don't trust them. Who do you think would pay hundreds/ thousands of $ for some random digital item? Think more.

comments.author: BADecker
comments.body: ^^^ Exactly!The only way you will win with NFTs is to develop something new and extremely catchy, or to find a way to use your NFT, by developing right inside it, a method to give anybody an opportunity to make lots of money just by using it. Of course, this would be a development thing, a programming, so it might be more work than making a simple NFT like most people do.Consider that the first Star Wars movie was the fourth Star Wars book. It's title was kind of like your thread here - A New Hope. George Lukas didn't start from the beginning of the story, because it made more sense to start where he did. Copy his genius, and start with what you know and what will work, rather than what other people have done in the past.

comments.author: AndyGryffindor
comments.body: There are a lot of opportunities out there, for anyone willing to do the work. Think outside the box. Maybe build the Nakamoto diesel fuel saver and go around offering to treat peoples fuel tanks for free as a side hustle? You would be working for tips as you can't ask for the money! If you get a business license first then you can ask to be paid for the service. One fuel saver can treat thousands of vehicles, just make sure that you use a plastic storage container to keep it in when you are not using it. https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=5403404.0

comments.author: aseev
comments.body: I call on everyone to start dissociating NFTs from crapy pictures and distinguishing NFT art as a subset of non-fungible tokens. NFT art is synonymous with NFTs now but there are NFTs that are useful and have value (like event tickets, in-game and metaverse assets, licenses, etc.).
